properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 11:45PM EST until February 8 at 8:20AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Record severity for the
Broad River in SC Near Blacksburg affecting Cherokee and York Counties...

The Flood Warning continues for the Broad River near Blacksburg.
* At 11:15 PM Thursday the stage was 23.1 feet
* Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet.
* Record flooding is occurring.
* FORECAST: the river will hover just above 23 feet overnight.
The river will fall below Minor Flood Stage Friday evening.
* Impact...At 22.0 feet...The Broad River is at levels similar to
those that occurred in September 2004 due to Hurricane Frances.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet...Floodwaters may be impacting access to
the Cherokee Falls powerhouse and inundating residential yards
adjacent to the river.  Also, several secondary roads near the
river may be inundated.
properties.instruction:
Please report high water...flooding and landslides to the National
Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free...1...8 0
0...2 6 7...8 1 0 1...or by posting on our Facebook page...or tweet
it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and
the specific location where it occurred.
